before.title: Create unified lib/backup.sh library
before.description: Phase 1 of unified backup architecture. Create centralized backup library with: create_backup(type, file, options), restore_backup(backup_id, options), rotate_backups(type, max), list_backups(type), get_backup_metadata(backup_id). Types: snapshot, safety, incremental, archive, migration. See: claudedocs/BACKUP-ARCHITECTURE.md for full spec.

before.title: Implement backup type taxonomy and directory structure
before.description: New directory structure: .claude/backups/snapshot/, .claude/backups/safety/, .claude/backups/incremental/, .claude/backups/archive/, .claude/backups/migration/. before.title: P0: Fix task ID collision under concurrent operations
before.description: File locking exists but ID generation happens BEFORE lock acquisition. Under concurrent load (5 parallel adds), all processes generate same ID causing 80% data loss. Solution: Move ID generation inside locked critical section. See claudedocs/P0-1-RACE-CONDITION-ISSUE.md for full root cause analysis, fix requirements, and implementation plan.

before.title: Add dependency check to install.sh before installation
before.description: install.sh should check for required dependencies (jq, bash 4+) BEFORE installing. Currently installs without checking, leaving user with broken install. Add check_dependencies() function that: 1) Checks jq exists, 2) Checks bash version >= 4.0, 3) Provides platform-specific install instructions, 4) Optionally offers to install deps (apt/brew/yum).

after.title: Phase 2: Specialist Analysis - 5 parallel domain investigations

before.title: Phase 3: Challenge & Consensus - Round-robin adversarial validation
before.description: Adversarial validation phase. ROUND 1: Each agent presents findings (max 200 tokens/claim with evidence citations). ROUND 2: Cross-examination (each agent challenges 2 others, format: 'Claim X assumes Y, but evidence Z contradicts'). ROUND 3: Consensus voting (PROVEN: 4/5 + reproducible evidence, REFUTED: counter-evidence invalidates, CONTESTED: 3/5 split). Gate: All 10 claims have verdict.

after.title: Phase 3: Challenge & Consensus - Round-robin adversarial validation

before.title: FEATURE: Multi-Phase Consensus Research Framework Plugin
before.description:
Build a reusable plugin/command for claude-todo that implements the Multi-Phase Consensus Research Framework. This would be a programmatically callable tool with prompt-style instructions for any project to use when investigating claims, validating features, or planning complex work.

## CONCEPT
A repeatable, structured process for rigorous multi-agent investigation with:
- Configurable phases (Discovery  Adversarial  Consolidation  Validation  Final)
- Agent role definitions (Advocate/Challenger/Arbiter pattern)
- Gate-based progression (scope approval, conflict resolution, archive approval, completeness sign-off)
- Evidence standards and consensus thresholds
- Artifact generation (reports, specs, corrections)

## PROPOSED STRUCTURE
| Round | Purpose | Agents | Gate |
|-------|---------|--------|------|
| Round 1 | Discovery & Inventory | 6 inventory agents | Gate 1: Scope approval |
| Round 2 | Adversarial Challenge | 15 (5 domains  Advocate/Challenger/Arbiter) | Gate 2: Conflict resolution |
| Round 3 | Consolidation | 7 merge agents | Gate 3: Archive approval |
| Round 4 | Validation | 3 fresh validation agents | Gate 4: Completeness sign-off |
| Round 5 | Final Spec | 2 finalization agents | Gate 5: Implementation GO |

## INVOCATION
```bash
claude-todo research --framework consensus \
  --claims 'claim1.md,claim2.md' \
  --evidence-dir ./evidence \
  --output-dir ./consensus-output \
  --agents 5 \
  --threshold 0.8
```

## KEY FEATURES
1. Prompt-driven agent deployment (subagent_type patterns)
2. Round-robin challenge protocol with configurable rounds
3. Evidence standards (reproducible tests, measurements, citations)
4. Consensus thresholds (4/5 default, configurable)
5. Artifact templates (report, feature spec, doc correction, evidence dossier)
6. Gate progression with approval checkpoints
7. Deadlock resolution mechanisms
8. Context handoff for long investigations

## IMPLEMENTATION NOTES
- Could be a Claude Code plugin or claude-todo subcommand
- Needs integration with Task tool for agent deployment
- Should support both interactive and batch modes
- Evidence dossiers should be machine-readable (JSON) and human-readable (MD)
- Consider Serena MCP integration for code analysis phases

## SUCCESS CRITERIA
- Repeatable: Same inputs produce consistent process
- Valuable output: Single consolidated report, not scattered docs
- Configurable: Adjust agents, rounds, thresholds per project
- Transparent: Full evidence trail for all decisions

before.title: FEATURE: Multi-Phase Consensus Research Framework Plugin
before.description:
Build a reusable plugin/command for claude-todo that implements the Multi-Phase Consensus Research Framework. This would be a programmatically callable tool with prompt-style instructions for any project to use when investigating claims, validating features, or planning complex work.

## CONCEPT
A repeatable, structured process for rigorous multi-agent investigation with:
- Configurable phases (Discovery  Adversarial  Consolidation  Validation  Final)
- Agent role definitions (Advocate/Challenger/Arbiter pattern)
- Gate-based progression (scope approval, conflict resolution, archive approval, completeness sign-off)
- Evidence standards and consensus thresholds
- Artifact generation (reports, specs, corrections)

## PROPOSED STRUCTURE
| Round | Purpose | Agents | Gate |
|-------|---------|--------|------|
| Round 1 | Discovery & Inventory | 6 inventory agents | Gate 1: Scope approval |
| Round 2 | Adversarial Challenge | 15 (5 domains  Advocate/Challenger/Arbiter) | Gate 2: Conflict resolution |
| Round 3 | Consolidation | 7 merge agents | Gate 3: Archive approval |
| Round 4 | Validation | 3 fresh validation agents | Gate 4: Completeness sign-off |
| Round 5 | Final Spec | 2 finalization agents | Gate 5: Implementation GO |

## INVOCATION
```bash
claude-todo research --framework consensus \
  --claims 'claim1.md,claim2.md' \
  --evidence-dir ./evidence \
  --output-dir ./consensus-output \
  --agents 5 \
  --threshold 0.8
```

## KEY FEATURES
1. Prompt-driven agent deployment (subagent_type patterns)
2. Round-robin challenge protocol with configurable rounds
3. Evidence standards (reproducible tests, measurements, citations)
4. Consensus thresholds (4/5 default, configurable)
5. Artifact templates (report, feature spec, doc correction, evidence dossier)
6. Gate progression with approval checkpoints
7. Deadlock resolution mechanisms
8. Context handoff for long investigations

## IMPLEMENTATION NOTES
- Could be a Claude Code plugin or claude-todo subcommand
- Needs integration with Task tool for agent deployment
- Should support both interactive and batch modes
- Evidence dossiers should be machine-readable (JSON) and human-readable (MD)
- Consider Serena MCP integration for code analysis phases

## SUCCESS CRITERIA
- Repeatable: Same inputs produce consistent process
- Valuable output: Single consolidated report, not scattered docs
- Configurable: Adjust agents, rounds, thresholds per project
- Transparent: Full evidence trail for all decisions

before.title: T204.1: Configuration Schema Design
before.description:
Design YAML/JSON configuration schema for reusable consensus framework plugin.

## DELIVERABLE
`schemas/consensus-research-config.schema.json`

## SCHEMA MUST DEFINE
- claims: Array of claim definitions (id, title, description, category)
- evidence_sources: Paths to evidence directories/files
- agents: Agent configuration (count, types, subagent_type mappings)
- thresholds: Consensus thresholds (proven, refuted, contested)
- output: Output directory and file naming conventions
- gates: HITL gate configuration (which gates, timeout, blocking)
- phases: Phase definitions (which phases to run, order)

## EXAMPLE CONFIG
```yaml
framework: consensus-research
version: 1.0
investigation:
  name: "claude-todo-claims"
  claims_file: ./claims.yaml
  evidence_dir: ./evidence
  output_dir: ./consensus-output
agents:
  worker_count: 5
  synthesis_type: project-supervisor-orchestrator
thresholds:
  proven: 0.8  # 4/5
  refuted: 0.4  # 2/5
gates:
  - after_phase: 1
    blocking: true
    timeout: 24h
```

## REFERENCES
- claudedocs/CONSENSUS-FRAMEWORK-SPEC.md (Execution Protocol section)
- T204 parent task for context

before.title: T204.2: Parameterized Prompt Templates
before.description:
Create parameterized prompt templates for all 6 agent types.

## DELIVERABLE
`templates/consensus-research/` directory with:
- agent-technical.prompt.md
- agent-design.prompt.md
- agent-docs.prompt.md
- agent-impl.prompt.md
- agent-challenge.prompt.md
- agent-synthesis.prompt.md

## TEMPLATE VARIABLES
Each template must use placeholders:
- `{INVESTIGATION_NAME}` - Name of the investigation
- `{CLAIM_SET}` - List of claims assigned to this agent
- `{EVIDENCE_PATH}` - Path to phase 1 evidence file
- `{OUTPUT_PATH}` - Path where agent writes findings
- `{EVIDENCE_STANDARDS}` - Standards for this claim type
- `{CONSENSUS_THRESHOLD}` - Voting threshold
- `{OTHER_AGENT_OUTPUTS}` - Paths to other agent files (for synthesis)

## EXAMPLE TEMPLATE
```markdown
# {AGENT_ROLE} Agent

You are the {AGENT_ROLE} for the {INVESTIGATION_NAME} investigation.

## Your Assigned Claims
{CLAIM_SET}

## Evidence Baseline
Read evidence from: {EVIDENCE_PATH}

## Your Task
Investigate your assigned claims using {EVIDENCE_STANDARDS}.

## Output
Write findings to: {OUTPUT_PATH}

## Output Format
[structured template...]
```

## REFERENCES
- claudedocs/CONSENSUS-FRAMEWORK-SPEC.md (Agent Roles, Evidence Passing Protocol)

before.title: T204.3: State Management Design
before.description:
Design state management system for tracking investigation progress.

## DELIVERABLE
`schemas/consensus-research-state.schema.json` + implementation spec

## STATE FILE MUST TRACK
- current_phase: Which phase is active (1-4)
- phase_status: Per-phase completion status
- claims: Per-claim status and verdicts
- agents: Which agents have completed, their output paths
- gates: Gate status (pending, approved, rejected)
- questions: Collected questions with severity and status
- suspicious_consensus: Flagged unanimous agreements
- session: Current session ID, start time, last activity

## STATE TRANSITIONS
```
Phase 1: pending  active  evidence_collected  gate_1_pending  gate_1_approved
Phase 2: pending  agents_spawned  agents_complete  gate_2_pending  gate_2_approved
Phase 3: pending  synthesis_active  voting_complete  gate_3_pending  gate_3_approved
Phase 4: pending  artifacts_generating  complete  gate_4_approved
```

## PERSISTENCE
- State file: `.consensus-research/state.json`
- Atomic writes (temp file  validate  rename)
- Checksum for integrity
- Recovery from interrupted state

## INTEGRATION WITH CLAUDE-TODO
- Optionally create claude-todo tasks from state
- Sync state  task status
- Export state to TodoWrite format

## REFERENCES
- claudedocs/CONSENSUS-FRAMEWORK-SPEC.md (Completion Criteria, Position Identification)

before.title: T204.6: Error Recovery Protocols
before.description:
Define error handling and recovery protocols for framework robustness.

## DELIVERABLE
Error recovery section in spec + state recovery implementation

## ERROR SCENARIOS

### Agent Failure
- Worker agent returns error or incomplete output
- Mitigation: Retry with exponential backoff (max 3 attempts)
- Fallback: Mark claim as INSUFFICIENT_EVIDENCE, flag for HITL

### HITL Gate Timeout
- User doesn't respond within timeout period
- Mitigation: Reminder notification, extend timeout
- Fallback: Auto-proceed with Synthesis Agent recommendation (if configured)
- Alternative: Pause investigation, persist state for resume

### Session Interruption
- Context window exhausted mid-investigation
- Mitigation: State file persists all progress
- Recovery: New session reads state, resumes from last checkpoint
- Phase checkpoints: After each phase completion

### Conflicting Agent Outputs
- Two agents give contradictory evidence for same claim
- Mitigation: Challenge Agent reviews conflict
- Escalation: SUSPICIOUS_CONSENSUS or HITL gate

### Missing Evidence
- Phase 1 cannot find sufficient evidence for claims
- Mitigation: Flag claims as EVIDENCE_NEEDED
- Options: Proceed with available evidence, request more sources, abort claim

### State Corruption
- State file corrupted or invalid
- Mitigation: Checksum validation on read
- Recovery: Reconstruct from output files + claude-todo tasks
- Backup: Periodic state snapshots

## RECOVERY COMMANDS
```bash
claude-todo research --resume          # Resume from state file
claude-todo research --status          # Show current state
claude-todo research --recover         # Attempt state reconstruction
claude-todo research --abort           # Clean abort with state preservation
```

## REFERENCES
- claudedocs/CONSENSUS-FRAMEWORK-SPEC.md (Risk Mitigation, Session Recovery)

before.title: T204.7: Invocation Modes Specification
before.description:
Define different invocation modes for the framework.

## DELIVERABLE
CLI specification section with all modes documented

## INVOCATION MODES

### Interactive Mode (Default)
```bash
claude-todo research --framework consensus --config ./research.yaml
```
- Pauses at each HITL gate for user input
- Shows progress in real-time
- Allows mid-investigation adjustments

### Batch Mode
```bash
claude-todo research --framework consensus --config ./research.yaml --batch
```
- Runs without HITL pauses (uses Synthesis Agent recommendations)
- Collects all questions for end-of-run review
- Suitable for overnight/unattended runs

### Dry Run Mode
```bash
claude-todo research --framework consensus --config ./research.yaml --dry-run
```
- Validates config, shows execution plan
- Lists claims, agents, phases, gates
- No actual agent spawning

### Resume Mode
```bash
claude-todo research --resume [state-file]
```
- Resumes from persisted state
- Validates state integrity before resuming
- Shows what was completed, what remains

### Status Mode
```bash
claude-todo research --status [state-file]
```
- Shows current investigation status
- Phase progress, claim verdicts, pending gates
- No modification

### Single Phase Mode
```bash
claude-todo research --phase 2 --config ./research.yaml
```
- Run only specific phase
- Requires prior phase outputs to exist
- Useful for re-running failed phases

| --config | Path to config YAML |
| --framework | Framework type (consensus, adversarial, etc.) |

before.title: T204.3: State Management Design
before.description:

## STATE FILE MUST TRACK
- current_phase: Which phase is active (1-4)
- phase_status: Per-phase completion status
- claims: Per-claim status and verdicts
- agents: Which agents have completed, their output paths
- gates: Gate status (pending, approved, rejected)
- questions: Collected questions with severity and status
- suspicious_consensus: Flagged unanimous agreements
- session: Current session ID, start time, last activity

## STATE TRANSITIONS
```
Phase 1: pending  active  evidence_collected  gate_1_pending  gate_1_approved
Phase 2: pending  agents_spawned  agents_complete  gate_2_pending  gate_2_approved
Phase 3: pending  synthesis_active  voting_complete  gate_3_pending  gate_3_approved
Phase 4: pending  artifacts_generating  complete  gate_4_approved
```

## PERSISTENCE
- State file: `.consensus-research/state.json`
- Atomic writes (temp file  validate  rename)
- Checksum for integrity
- Recovery from interrupted state

## INTEGRATION WITH CLAUDE-TODO
- Optionally create claude-todo tasks from state
- Sync state  task status
- Export state to TodoWrite format

before.title: T204.6: Error Recovery Protocols
before.description:
Define error handling and recovery protocols for framework robustness.

## DELIVERABLE
Error recovery section in spec + state recovery implementation

## ERROR SCENARIOS

### Agent Failure
- Worker agent returns error or incomplete output
- Mitigation: Retry with exponential backoff (max 3 attempts)
- Fallback: Mark claim as INSUFFICIENT_EVIDENCE, flag for HITL

### HITL Gate Timeout
- User doesn't respond within timeout period
- Mitigation: Reminder notification, extend timeout
- Fallback: Auto-proceed with Synthesis Agent recommendation (if configured)
- Alternative: Pause investigation, persist state for resume

### Session Interruption
- Context window exhausted mid-investigation
- Mitigation: State file persists all progress
- Recovery: New session reads state, resumes from last checkpoint
- Phase checkpoints: After each phase completion

### Conflicting Agent Outputs
- Two agents give contradictory evidence for same claim
- Mitigation: Challenge Agent reviews conflict
- Escalation: SUSPICIOUS_CONSENSUS or HITL gate

### Missing Evidence
- Phase 1 cannot find sufficient evidence for claims
- Mitigation: Flag claims as EVIDENCE_NEEDED
- Options: Proceed with available evidence, request more sources, abort claim

### State Corruption
- State file corrupted or invalid
- Mitigation: Checksum validation on read
- Recovery: Reconstruct from output files + claude-todo tasks
- Backup: Periodic state snapshots

## RECOVERY COMMANDS
```bash
claude-todo research --resume          # Resume from state file
claude-todo research --status          # Show current state
claude-todo research --recover         # Attempt state reconstruction
claude-todo research --abort           # Clean abort with state preservation
```

## REFERENCES
- claudedocs/CONSENSUS-FRAMEWORK-SPEC.md (Risk Mitigation, Session Recovery)

before.title: FEATURE: Multi-Phase Consensus Research Framework Plugin
before.description:
Build a reusable plugin/command for claude-todo that implements the Multi-Phase Consensus Research Framework. This would be a programmatically callable tool with prompt-style instructions for any project to use when investigating claims, validating features, or planning complex work.

## CONCEPT
A repeatable, structured process for rigorous multi-agent investigation with:
- Configurable phases (Discovery  Adversarial  Consolidation  Validation  Final)
- Agent role definitions (Advocate/Challenger/Arbiter pattern)
- Gate-based progression (scope approval, conflict resolution, archive approval, completeness sign-off)
- Evidence standards and consensus thresholds
- Artifact generation (reports, specs, corrections)

## PROPOSED STRUCTURE
| Round | Purpose | Agents | Gate |
|-------|---------|--------|------|
| Round 1 | Discovery & Inventory | 6 inventory agents | Gate 1: Scope approval |
| Round 2 | Adversarial Challenge | 15 (5 domains  Advocate/Challenger/Arbiter) | Gate 2: Conflict resolution |
| Round 3 | Consolidation | 7 merge agents | Gate 3: Archive approval |
| Round 4 | Validation | 3 fresh validation agents | Gate 4: Completeness sign-off |
| Round 5 | Final Spec | 2 finalization agents | Gate 5: Implementation GO |

## INVOCATION
```bash
claude-todo research --framework consensus \
  --claims 'claim1.md,claim2.md' \
  --evidence-dir ./evidence \
  --output-dir ./consensus-output \
  --agents 5 \
  --threshold 0.8
```

## KEY FEATURES
1. Prompt-driven agent deployment (subagent_type patterns)
2. Round-robin challenge protocol with configurable rounds
3. Evidence standards (reproducible tests, measurements, citations)
4. Consensus thresholds (4/5 default, configurable)
5. Artifact templates (report, feature spec, doc correction, evidence dossier)
6. Gate progression with approval checkpoints
7. Deadlock resolution mechanisms
8. Context handoff for long investigations

## IMPLEMENTATION NOTES
- Could be a Claude Code plugin or claude-todo subcommand
- Needs integration with Task tool for agent deployment
- Should support both interactive and batch modes
- Evidence dossiers should be machine-readable (JSON) and human-readable (MD)
- Consider Serena MCP integration for code analysis phases

## SUCCESS CRITERIA
- Repeatable: Same inputs produce consistent process
- Valuable output: Single consolidated report, not scattered docs
- Configurable: Adjust agents, rounds, thresholds per project
- Transparent: Full evidence trail for all decisions

| Round 5 | Final Spec | 2 finalization agents | Gate 5: Implementation GO |

## INVOCATION
```bash
claude-todo research --framework consensus \
  --claims 'claim1.md,claim2.md' \
  --evidence-dir ./evidence \
  --output-dir ./consensus-output \
  --agents 5 \
  --threshold 0.8
```

## KEY FEATURES
1. Prompt-driven agent deployment (subagent_type patterns)
2. Round-robin challenge protocol with configurable rounds
3. Evidence standards (reproducible tests, measurements, citations)
4. Consensus thresholds (4/5 default, configurable)
5. Artifact templates (report, feature spec, doc correction, evidence dossier)
6. Gate progression with approval checkpoints
7. Deadlock resolution mechanisms
8. Context handoff for long investigations

## IMPLEMENTATION NOTES
- Could be a Claude Code plugin or claude-todo subcommand
- Needs integration with Task tool for agent deployment
- Should support both interactive and batch modes
- Evidence dossiers should be machine-readable (JSON) and human-readable (MD)
- Consider Serena MCP integration for code analysis phases

## SUCCESS CRITERIA
- Repeatable: Same inputs produce consistent process
- Valuable output: Single consolidated report, not scattered docs
- Configurable: Adjust agents, rounds, thresholds per project
- Transparent: Full evidence trail for all decisions

before.title: FEATURE: Multi-Phase Consensus Research Framework Plugin
before.description:
Build a reusable plugin/command for claude-todo that implements the Multi-Phase Consensus Research Framework. This would be a programmatically callable tool with prompt-style instructions for any project to use when investigating claims, validating features, or planning complex work.

## CONCEPT
A repeatable, structured process for rigorous multi-agent investigation with:
- Configurable phases (Discovery  Adversarial  Consolidation  Validation  Final)
- Agent role definitions (Advocate/Challenger/Arbiter pattern)
- Gate-based progression (scope approval, conflict resolution, archive approval, completeness sign-off)
- Evidence standards and consensus thresholds
- Artifact generation (reports, specs, corrections)

## PROPOSED STRUCTURE
| Round | Purpose | Agents | Gate |
|-------|---------|--------|------|
| Round 1 | Discovery & Inventory | 6 inventory agents | Gate 1: Scope approval |
| Round 2 | Adversarial Challenge | 15 (5 domains  Advocate/Challenger/Arbiter) | Gate 2: Conflict resolution |
| Round 3 | Consolidation | 7 merge agents | Gate 3: Archive approval |
| Round 4 | Validation | 3 fresh validation agents | Gate 4: Completeness sign-off |
| Round 5 | Final Spec | 2 finalization agents | Gate 5: Implementation GO |

## INVOCATION
```bash
claude-todo research --framework consensus \
  --claims 'claim1.md,claim2.md' \
  --evidence-dir ./evidence \
  --output-dir ./consensus-output \
  --agents 5 \
  --threshold 0.8
```

## KEY FEATURES
1. Prompt-driven agent deployment (subagent_type patterns)
2. Round-robin challenge protocol with configurable rounds
3. Evidence standards (reproducible tests, measurements, citations)
4. Consensus thresholds (4/5 default, configurable)
5. Artifact templates (report, feature spec, doc correction, evidence dossier)
6. Gate progression with approval checkpoints
7. Deadlock resolution mechanisms
8. Context handoff for long investigations

## IMPLEMENTATION NOTES
- Could be a Claude Code plugin or claude-todo subcommand
- Needs integration with Task tool for agent deployment
- Should support both interactive and batch modes
- Evidence dossiers should be machine-readable (JSON) and human-readable (MD)
- Consider Serena MCP integration for code analysis phases

## SUCCESS CRITERIA
- Repeatable: Same inputs produce consistent process
- Valuable output: Single consolidated report, not scattered docs
- Configurable: Adjust agents, rounds, thresholds per project
- Transparent: Full evidence trail for all decisions

before.title: FEATURE: Multi-Phase Consensus Research Framework Plugin
before.description:
Build a reusable plugin/command for claude-todo that implements the Multi-Phase Consensus Research Framework. This would be a programmatically callable tool with prompt-style instructions for any project to use when investigating claims, validating features, or planning complex work.

## CONCEPT
A repeatable, structured process for rigorous multi-agent investigation with:
- Configurable phases (Discovery  Adversarial  Consolidation  Validation  Final)
- Agent role definitions (Advocate/Challenger/Arbiter pattern)
- Gate-based progression (scope approval, conflict resolution, archive approval, completeness sign-off)
- Evidence standards and consensus thresholds
- Artifact generation (reports, specs, corrections)

## PROPOSED STRUCTURE
| Round | Purpose | Agents | Gate |
|-------|---------|--------|------|
| Round 1 | Discovery & Inventory | 6 inventory agents | Gate 1: Scope approval |
| Round 2 | Adversarial Challenge | 15 (5 domains  Advocate/Challenger/Arbiter) | Gate 2: Conflict resolution |
| Round 3 | Consolidation | 7 merge agents | Gate 3: Archive approval |
| Round 4 | Validation | 3 fresh validation agents | Gate 4: Completeness sign-off |
| Round 5 | Final Spec | 2 finalization agents | Gate 5: Implementation GO |

## INVOCATION
```bash
claude-todo research --framework consensus \
  --claims 'claim1.md,claim2.md' \
  --evidence-dir ./evidence \
  --output-dir ./consensus-output \
  --agents 5 \
  --threshold 0.8
```

## KEY FEATURES
1. Prompt-driven agent deployment (subagent_type patterns)
2. Round-robin challenge protocol with configurable rounds
3. Evidence standards (reproducible tests, measurements, citations)
4. Consensus thresholds (4/5 default, configurable)
5. Artifact templates (report, feature spec, doc correction, evidence dossier)
6. Gate progression with approval checkpoints
7. Deadlock resolution mechanisms
8. Context handoff for long investigations

## IMPLEMENTATION NOTES
- Could be a Claude Code plugin or claude-todo subcommand
- Needs integration with Task tool for agent deployment
- Should support both interactive and batch modes
- Evidence dossiers should be machine-readable (JSON) and human-readable (MD)
- Consider Serena MCP integration for code analysis phases

## SUCCESS CRITERIA
- Repeatable: Same inputs produce consistent process
- Valuable output: Single consolidated report, not scattered docs
- Configurable: Adjust agents, rounds, thresholds per project
- Transparent: Full evidence trail for all decisions
